New Records: Freddie Freeman won World Series MVP, hitting four homers and driving in 12 runs across the five games.
Key Match Events: The Dodgers rallies from a 5-0 deficit to win 7-6 in Game 5.
The game went into the fifth inning with three fielding miscues by the Yankees, allowing the Dodgers to score five runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams were bringing back their starters from the opening game of the series.
The Yankees went with the same batting lineup as the night before.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts emphasized the team's resilience and determination.
The Yankees have not won a World Series since 2009.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shohei Ohtani made his World Series debut and was part of the Dodgers' championship run.
The Dodgers won their second World Series in the last five years.
Others: Yankee Stadium hosted Hideki Matsui's ceremonial first pitch before Game 5.
